starter.title: A rough start
starter.flavour_text:
Welcome to the Yellow Sky alpha!

This game focuses on resource management and exploration of a post-apocalyptic wasteland, set 200 years in the future. Mankind ignored scientists' warnings regarding the environment, and waged war for ever dwindling resources. Nuclear fallout and chemical gases gathered in the atmosphere, dyeing the sky a perpetual, sickening yellow.

90% of the world's population was wiped out, but humans are ever resilient and endure in the form of small groups and settlements.

However, natural disasters ravage the earth at a near constant, coupled with other dangers. You are the sole survivor of one such disaster which destroyed your own settlement. It's up to you to forge ahead and do something good for the world. One person can make a difference.

The red bar represents your health, which drains when you're hungry. The yellow bar represents your stamina, which drains when you move. Eat food to restore your stamina, or you'll go hungry!

There are four resources in the game: Scrap, energy, water and seeds. Scrap is used for building, energy for powering machinery, water to produce food and seeds to spread greenery. Right now, you'll only be using scrap and energy.

Use WASD to move and E to interact with objects of interest. Hovering your cursor over most things reveals tooltips.

quest1_event.title: Flying Monkey Men's Lair
quest1_event.flavour_text:
Amidst the rubble, you can see subtle movement in the distance. As soon as you step further in to investigate though, you hear a screeching noise pierce through the air. 

Glowing red eyes and velvety wings emerge through the scraps, as the screeches multiply and the tension rises. Not being sure how to deal with this fateful encounter, you throw some leftover food into the demonic mess of limbs and sharp smiling teeth that started to form, in hopes that something positive would come out out of the situation. 

As soon as the can of food clanks into the floor, the frenzy appears to stop, and the creatures seem to make way for what it seems to be an injured specimen, that slowly but surely makes its way to the can that by now was spilling all over the floor. Eagerly, the wounded creature devours the measly food that the can contained, and while the portion wasn't much to write home about, a look of satisfaction seems to emerge on the small crooked, and now dirty, face. Seeing this, other elements of the group help raise the wounded critter up, and with a rejuvenated look, it spreads its wings wide and takes flight, with the rest of the group following close behind. Their screems echo in the distance, while the site returns to the emptiness that is so common around these parts. 

Having lost some food that was not that great to begin with, you decide to leave the area.

quest2_event.title: Abandoned C-Beam Emitter
quest2_event.flavour_text:
Deciding to enter through what appears to be a small door on the side of the crumbling makeshift device, light can be seen at the end of the corridor, emanating from sparks that jolt out of a curiously shaped object. Upon further inspection, and after disconnecting the power for safety measures, the strange object turns out to be a vintage model of the X series of generators produced by the long gone Macrosoft company, known for their green energy line of products back in the day. 

Stashing the generator to the best of your abilities into your backpack, you quickly leave the dampy corridor and go back to the painful aridness of the outside world.
